title: I need to standardize, tokenize, and then deliver a logstash config, output, and rspec file from a Palo Alto network device.
snippet:
*Due Date is Monday, Oct. 31 at midnight EST/0400 UTC*

Overview:

First, a set of raw logs need to be tokenized and standardized. During this step, the raw logs are converted into a JSON representation using a common set of key names.

Tokenization and standardization:

The goal of this task is to do the tokenization and standardization of a log source. The log in question is from a Palo Alto Networks device. For documentation about the logs themselves, visit
https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/documentation/71/pan-os/pan-os/monitoring/syslog-field-descriptions

The tokenization and standardization are to be done in Logstash:
https://www.elastic.co/products/logstash

Questions to answer about the incoming log sources are:
- What format are the source data in? Does logstash natively support this format?
- How many different types of messages are there?
- Are all of the messages useful / informative?
- What are the interesting attributes that we want to extract from the logs?
- Are there existing attribute names that we could leverage?
- Is there any other transformation that needs to be done at this stage?

The example logstash configuration should read the input data from a file and write the output to a separate file.

The output log lines should be JSON formatted.

In addition to the mapping itself, the graph mapping should also contain an rspec file. An rspec file is essentially a unit test that verifies that a raw log is correctly tokenized.

Additional details in the attached file. Data file will be shared once the project is ready to start.
